content.speaker: NARRATOR 2
content.text: Late that evening, Odysseus prepares to bathe before bedtime.

content.speaker: NARRATOR 1
content.text: An old nurse pours hot water into a tub for him.

content.speaker: EURYKLEIA
content.text: I have been here at this palace for many years. I was in the room when Odysseus himself was born and received him in my arms before his own mother did.

content.speaker: ODYSSEUS
content.text: Kind woman, you have been of great service to this household.

content.speaker: EURYKLEIA
content.text: I even raised up young Telemachus. The misery I have seen in this home since the master left so many years ago for Troy to fight! All because of a woman named Helen! My lady’s heart is weary.

content.speaker: ODYSSEUS
content.text: Tomorrow will be the end of her sorrows.

content.speaker: NARRATOR 2
content.text: The old woman looks up from her work and notices a scar on Odysseus’ knee. She jumps back and looks into his eyes.

content.speaker: EURYKLEIA
content.text: Only one person could have a scar like that. How did you get that scar?

content.speaker: ODYSSEUS
content.text: A wild boar tore into my leg when I was young.

content.speaker: EURYKLEIA
content.text: You were on a hunt with your father . . . Odysseus? Odysseus! Great Zeus, we have been delivered!

content.speaker: NARRATOR 1
content.text: Eurykleia throws her arms around Odysseus and welcomes him home.

content.speaker: ODYSSEUS
content.text: Come, dear lady, let me tell you how you can help us with our plan. (They exit.)
